item.title: China Passes Hong Kong Security Law Aimed at Crushing Protests
item.description: China’s legislature approved a sweeping new law aimed at quashing threats to national security in Hong Kong, rejecting Western criticism that Beijing’s efforts will curb people’s freedoms in the protest-torn city.

item.title: Trump Administration Draws Bipartisan Pressure Over Russia 'Bounty' Intelligence
item.description: Republican and Democratic lawmakers united around demands that the White House detail intelligence indicating Russia had paid bounties to insurgents to have American forces killed in Afghanistan, and explain why President Trump apparently wasn’t briefed on the threat to U.S. troops.

item.title: India Blocks Chinese Apps, Including TikTok, After Border Clash
item.description: India banned dozens of Chinese mobile apps, including widely used TikTok and WeChat, after a border clash between troops from the two countries left 20 Indian soldiers dead this month.

item.title: China Releases American FedEx Pilot Held for Nine Months
item.description: Chinese authorities freed retired U.S. Air Force colonel Todd A. Hohn, who was under investigation for smuggling ammunition, easing a pressure point on the shipping giant that has been in Beijing’s crosshairs amid disputes between the U.S. and China.

item.title: World Leaders Reboot Face-to-Face Diplomacy
item.description: After months of virtual interactions, world leaders are cautiously restarting face-to-face meetings amid growing frustration at the limits of remote diplomacy.

item.title: Russia Reinforces Foothold in Libya as Militia Leader Retreats
item.description: Moscow is sending reinforcements to Libyan military leader Khalifa Haftar while shopping for new allies in the divided country, as Moscow seeks to shape the fate of the nation and its oil reserves.
